paper.title: On random 2---3 trees

author.org: (Computer Science Department, Stanford University, Stanford, USA)

paper.abstract: It is shown that ¯n (N), the average number of nodes in an N-key random 2---3 tree, satisfies the inequality 0.70 N u003c ¯n(N) u003c0.79 N for large N. A similar analysis is done for general B-trees. It is shown that storage utilization is essentially ln 2?69% for B-tree of high orders.
